page.title: 05THE VICAR
page.content: Mr John Barff, Parish Minister for Compton Greenfield, Pilning and Severn Beach has a large responsibility, is very busy and doesn't have much spare time. He came in 1983 after overseas voluntary and missionary work with the Church Missionary Society at a Theological College in The Sudan. His wife is a doctor, they have three daughters. He is a Governor of our school. Mr Barff joins in Friday Assemblies, and usually talks to us. A typical day starts at 7.00. He takes his daughters to school after their breakfast then works in his office at the vicarage in Pilning until lunchtime. He may prepare sermons, choose hymns,write letters and reply to letters. After lunch he may visit the old,sick and needy in their homes, hospital or prison, or sort out people's family problems.
